intro: Mecardonia acuminata var. peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
